page.title: 13Agriculture
page.content: The inland area of this part of the Isle of Wight is mostly designated to farmland.Some are old established family farms,others are owned by farmers from other parts of the island.Over fifty years ago the fields were smaller and divided by hedges.The farming was mixed farming.Today there is predominantly arable farming.The most popular crops being wheat,barley and potatoes.There are some dairy and beef herds and some farms have small flocks of sheep.Some farms use the fertilised grassland for silage or hay.The farmers use modern machinery and fertilisers including aerial spraying.People living in the area were concerned about pollution.We received no information to indicate that the farmers were using computers or new technology as an aid to farm management.
